GBADs at the Big Data in Animal Health W.message: GBADs at the Big Data in Animal Health Webinar

Presentation at the Big Data in Animal H.message: Presentation at the Big Data in Animal Health Webinar

GBADs Informatics co-lead Theresa Bernar.message: GBADs Informatics co-lead Theresa Bernardo presented at the Big Data in Animal Health webinar organised by the Health for Animals association. After providing an overview of the technologies and apps showing the potentials that could be unleashed from animal health data, Theresa presented the GBADs program, its goals and progress so far. She also highlighted the need for quality and reproducible data to better leverage their use when estimating animal health investments.

To learn more about this topic, you can.message: To learn more about this topic, you can watch the presentation here. More information about this event can be found in the Health for Animals website

GBADs Shout-Out at the Datasphere Initia.message: GBADs Shout-Out at the Datasphere Initiative Launch

GBADs at the launch of the Datasphere In.message: GBADs at the launch of the Datasphere Initiative

GBADs Informatics Technical Manager Kass.message: GBADs Informatics Technical Manager Kassy Raymond (also a Datasphere Initiative Fellow) was a panelist at the recent launch event for the Datasphere Initiative, where she described her work with GBADs to highlight why data quality, sharing, interoperability, reusability, and discoverability are important.

from minutes 26-31, and learn more about.message: from minutes 26-31, and learn more about the launch event

Graph Data in the Datasphere: How Graph.message: Graph Data in the Datasphere: How Graph Databases Can Help Us Understand the Data Connections in the Datasphere

GBADs Informatics team member Kassy Raym.message: GBADs Informatics team member Kassy Raymond published a blog explaining how graph databases can help us visualize data, reveal trends and patterns in the data, and facilitate trust through understanding data flows. Graph databases are in integral part of the GBADs knowledge engine, and will help us maximize our use of identified data sources.

To learn more, read the blog.message: To learn more, read the blog

Information on how GBADs Informatics pla.message: Information on how GBADs Informatics plans to use graph databses can be found in the

Current GBADs Informatics team members D.message: Current GBADs Informatics team members Deborah Stacey and Theresa Bernardo and past team members Kenneth Wulff and Nidhip Chikhalla have recently published a paper titled \"From FAIR to FAIRS: Data security by design for the global burden of animal diseases\" in Agronomy Journal. Data and metadata should be FAIR - Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable. This paper describes the need for GBADs to adopt an additional dimension, Security, taking FAIR to FAIRS. GBADs will need to securely manage an increasing amount of sensitive and private data. The Informatics team's plan for doing so is centered around data sharing in the cloud to \"facilitate our vision of a decentralized, nonhierarchical organization of data, tools, and models.\"

To learn more, read the paper, which can.message: To learn more, read the paper, which can be found at

GBADs at the Annual Forum of the Nationa.message: GBADs at the Annual Forum of the National Farmed Animal Health and Welfare Council

GBADs Informatics co-lead Theresa Bernar.message: GBADs Informatics co-lead Theresa Bernardo, together with Liverpool colleague Ben Huntington, presented at the Annual Forum of the National Farmed Animal Health and Welfare Council (now known as Animal Health Canada). One of three invited talks at the forum, Theresa and Ben introduced the GBADs program, vision, and Informatics workflow to Canadian stakeholders.

More details about the 2021 forum and fu.message: More details about the 2021 forum and future events can be found at the

This link takes you to our Data Portal A.message: This link takes you to our Data Portal API where you can learn how to make queries on the GBADs database tables.

Check out all of our Dashboards!.message: Check out all of our Dashboards!

Find documentation for using our Data Po.message: Find documentation for using our Data Portal, Knowledge Engine, and Software Tools

Our site has manuals, tutorials, videos,.message: Our site has manuals, tutorials, videos, and presentations that will help with using our data portal acess through APIs and Dashboards and software tools in Python and R.

All papers, abstracts, and research pres.message: All papers, abstracts, and research presentations are found here as well as information on how to cite our work in formats that are friendly for many publishing software and platforms.

Learn more about GBADs through our Youtu.message: Learn more about GBADs through our Youtube channel, and Github account!

Welcome to the Global Burden of Animal D.message: Welcome to the Global Burden of Animal Diseases Dashboard Landing Page! This page provides links to our interactive dashboards that we are using to explore data and results towards our goal of calculating the economic and health disease burden of animal diseases.

The Population Dashboards provide access.message: The Population Dashboards provide access to livestock population data at national and subnational levels, while the Biomass Dashboard quantifies livestock biomass using different calculations. Analytical Dashboards show the results of our analytics and modelling efforts, such as the calculation of the Animal Health Loss Envelope and Total Economic Value. Explore the consistency of datasets with the FAOSTAT Visualizer dashboard and explore Data Stories through our Data Stories dashboards. To access and discover the datasets we are using in our calculations, use the Data Portal dashboards.

Collaborate, stay updated, and contribut.message: Collaborate, stay updated, and contribute your own data to enhance animal health worldwide. Our dashboards empower data-driven decision-making and facilitate collaboration for improved animal health and well-being worldwide.
